title: [BUG] Can't get the MCP tools to work: RuntimeError: Event loop is closed
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am trying to replace the normal tools by tools coming from a MCP server. My code is runnning inside a poetry venv.

```
server_parameters = StdioServerParameters(
    command="uvx",
    args=["mcp-server-time"],
    env={"UV_PYTHON": "3.12", **os.environ},
)
with ToolCollection.from_mcp(server_parameters) as tool_collection:
    agent = CodeAgent(
        tools=[*tool_collection.tools],
        model=model,
        prompt_templates=code_prompt_templates,
        additional_authorized_imports=["time", "numpy", "pandas", "json"],
    )
response = agent.run(
    task="Answer the user request with the tools you have. User input is: What is the time in Berlin?"
)
```
gives me
```

  berlin_time = get_current_time(timezone="Europe/Berlin")                                                                                                                                                                                                      
  print(berlin_time)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── 
Code execution failed at line 'berlin_time = get_current_time(timezone="Europe/Berlin")' due to: RuntimeError: Event loop is closed
[Step 1: Duration 2.95 seconds| Input tokens: 2,330 | Output tokens: 58]
```

In another mcp server, I can see that a log message coming from the server 

`Processing request of type ListToolsRequest`

So the server is spawned, but once it tries to access the tool, I get the same error as above

**Code to reproduce the error**
See above. Running `npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uvx mcp-server-time` I can access the mpc server just fine.

**Error logs (if any)**
See above

**Expected behavior**
The agent calls the tool

**Packages version:**
smolagents==1.12.0

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
author: wirtsi

- mcp

```
mcp==1.4.1
mcpadapt==0.0.15
```
Hi @wirtsi, thanks for reporting the issue. I will try to reproduce, any chance you are running this in a Jupyter Notebook? Or as a regular python script?
No, my code runs in a poetry pyenv (so `poetry run python main.py`)

Hmm actually after second thought you need to run your agent.run statement within the context manager otherwise the mcp server is not running. The mcp server / client only runs within the context manager
TLDR; just indent your response = ... statement
Ah blimey 🤦‍♂️ You are right, it totally makes sense. I thought the context is only needed when instantiating the tools. Thank you 🙏
How to add multiple mcp services???

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that correctly explains how to use MCP tools with the CodeAgent
Clarification about the proper scope/lifetime of the MCP server connection
A simple, actionable fix to the RuntimeError about the closed event loop

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM python:3.12-slim

# Set environment variable to avoid prompts during installation
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV UV_SYSTEM_PYTHON=1

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    curl \
    make \
    build-essential \
    nodejs \
    npm \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install UV for package management
RUN pip install --upgrade uv

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/huggingface/smolagents.git . \
    && git checkout 5b2882d4117a6d8a5d50a08b7d56aff1c3a25211

# Install the Model Context Protocol CLI tools
RUN npm install -g @modelcontextprotocol/inspector

# Install the package with all dependencies
# Include test and all extras to ensure we have everything needed
RUN uv pip install -e ".[dev,test,all]"

# Install additional dependencies needed for MCP tools
RUN uv pip install uvx

# Set the working directory to be ready for use
WORKDIR /app

# Default command (can be overridden)
CMD ["bash"]
